chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Damone Powell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin Damone Powell in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Justin Damone Powell in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Pursuant to negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders case dismissed but read-in to 2020CF2335 for sentencing purposes.

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Justin Damone Powell not in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Justin Damone Powell not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski for WIlliam Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom and scheduled off the record. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
At the request of defense counsel, and without objection from the state, scheduling conference is moved from 02-17-2022 to 02-18-2022 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Justin Damone Powell in court with Attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Justin Damone Powell in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Stipulation to the identification of the defendant agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  Sworn for the State: Detective D. Gaglione. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No driving during pendency of case.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SMB.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Justin Damone Powell in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Justin Damone Powell in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Justin Damone Powell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
